data.title: Visualization Support for Multi-criteria Decision Making in Software Issue Propagation
data.authors: Youngtaek Kim; Hyeon Jeon; Young-Ho Kim; Yuhoon Ki; Hyunjoo Song; Jinwook Seo
data.affiliation: Youngtaek Kim (Seoul National University, Republic of Korea; University of Maryland, USA), Hyeon Jeon (Seoul National University, Republic of Korea), Young-Ho Kim (University of Maryland, USA), Yuhoon Ki (Samsung Electronics, Suwon-si, Gyunggi-do, Republic of Korea), Hyunjoo Song (Soongsil University, Republic of Korea), Jinwook Seo (Seoul National University, Republic of Korea)
data.abstract: Finding the propagation scope for various types of issues in Software Product Lines (SPLs) is a complicated Multi-Criteria Decision Making (MCDM) problem. This task often requires human-in-the-loop data analysis, which covers not only multiple product attributes but also contextual information (e.g., internal policy, customer requirements, exceptional cases, cost efficiency). We propose an interactive visualization tool to support MCDM tasks in software issue propagation based on the user's mental model. Our tool enables users to explore multiple criteria with their insight intuitively and find the appropriate propagation scope.
